videos.title: Bernard ‘Pretty’ Purdie – The Legendary Purdie Shuffle
Billy Cobham Solo's on Drums at Montreux Jazz Festival 1976
Billy Cobham Taurian Matador Live 1974 [HQ Audio]

annotations.why_new: Rare Montreux footage showing Cobham’s raw power.
annotations.listen_for: Gravity-driven tom rhythms and thunderous kick patterns.
annotations.groove: Fusion swing with tight backbeat comping.
practice: Loop the opening tom motif for 2 minutes at 100 BPM
Work on fast double kick burst consistency

annotations.why_new: Deep dive into the Purdie shuffle; iconic groove demonstration.
annotations.listen_for: Ghosted snare notes beneath the swing feel.
annotations.groove: Half-time funk shuffle with subtle micro-timing variations.
practice: Practice shuffle ghost note control at 80 BPM
Add one fill every 8 bars in the same pattern

annotations.why_new: A live Cobham solo packed with energy and polyrhythms.
annotations.listen_for: Hand and foot separation during fast passages.
annotations.groove: Loose 4/4 groove overlaid with triplet fills.
practice: Isolate ride triplets, then add a tom backbeat
Play the combo idea at 90 BPM looped

annotations.why_new: Recent live performance—still grooving with soul.
annotations.listen_for: Tight hi-hat feel with pocketed snare hits.
annotations.groove: Warm funk groove, unforced and confident.
practice: Match hi-hat feel in your own groove at 85 BPM
Add subtle snare ghost notes in triplets

annotations.why_new: Rare HQ audio of Cobham’s 'Taurian Matador' in a live setting.
annotations.listen_for: Subtle ride bounce with hip jazz phrasing.
practice: Copy the ride phrasing for 16 bars slowly
Experiment with dynamic changes in your groove
